• Register
  • Spectate
  • Newcomer's Guide

Register

Registration is now closed. See the schedule here.

Have a question? Ask. fest@upartnerdance.org.

Pricing

  • All prices are are per person unless otherwise noted.
  • All competitors receive unlimited amateur and MP event entries, admission to all sessions, and a program.
  • If you are dancing only MP and only as the more proficient partner, your event entries are free and you may spectate at all sessions for free.
  • A student is anyone who is under the age of 18 or has a valid college ID.

 

Adult Student
Competitors 60 30
Admission to one session 5
Program 5 each

Limits

  • Each person may enter each event only once.
  • Each person may enter up to 2 consecutive proficiency levels per style.
  • You may not dance mixed proficiency and amateur with the same partner.

Ballroom and Latin

Smooth Standard Rhythm Latin

Jack and Jill Dances

There is no pre-registration for Jack and Jill events. Everyone present during these events may participate.

  • Cha Cha
  • Salsa
  • Waltz
  • West Coast Swing

Team Matches

Enter 3 couples in a team match. Each couple dances one dance.

American International
  • Foxtrot
    Rumba
    Swing
  • Waltz
    Tango
    Samba

Travel Advice

Destination

Dancers Studio
415 Pascal Street North
St. Paul MN 55104 (Map)

Parking

The Dancers Studio parking lot fits over 500 cars. You'll have plenty of room to park right at the studio.

Just a reminder:

Schedule

Saturday: Day Session

7 AM: Doors Open
8 AM: Latin Syllabus
12:00 PM: Lunch Break
1 PM: Smooth Syllabus
5 PM: Session Ends

Saturday: Evening Session

6:30 PM: Doors Open
7 PM: General Dancing
7:30 PM: Open Rhythm and Latin
8:30 PM: Open Smooth and Standard
10 PM: Team Events
11 PM: Session Ends

Sunday: Day Session

7:15 AM: Doors Open
8:00 AM: Rhythm Syllabus
12:00 PM: Lunch Break
1:00 PM: Standard Syllabus
4:00 PM: Strictly Dances
5:00 PM: Jack and Jill Dances
5:30 PM: Session Ends

Dance Fest is

a low-cost, beginner-friendly dancesport competition where:

  • New competitors can see what dancesport is about in a local, friendly environment without breaking the bank
  • Spectators can enjoy the beautiful dancing and spectator-sport atmosphere of the competition, particularly during the evening show
  • Experienced competitors can compete against some of the nationâ€™s best dancers in all styles and involve their local coaches for real-time feedback

Questions? Contact Us.

If you have any questions or need any assistance, please e-mail us at fest@upartnerdance.org.
